properties.areaDesc: Western Plumas County/Lassen Park; Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County; Northeast Foothills/Sacramento Valley
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 15 at 2:17PM PST until January 17 at 6:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
...Hazardous mountain travel expected this evening into early
Friday...

.A winter storm is expected to bring moderate to heavy snow to
the mountains and upper foothills this evening into Friday.
Mountain travel during this time will be very difficult with
reduced visibility, chain controls, and possible road closures.
Gusty winds may bring periods of whiteout conditions. Plan ahead
and continue to monitor the forecast.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Travel will be very difficult to
impossible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 feet, with
locally higher amounts across the peaks, are expected.

* WHERE...Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County, Northeast
Foothills/Sacramento Valley and Western Plumas County/Lassen
Park.

* WHEN...Midnight to 6 AM Friday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels lowering to 1000 to 2500 feet
by Thursday night.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means there will be snow covered
roads and limited visibilities. Travel is not recommended while
the warning is in effect. If you must travel, keep an extra
flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an
emergency.The latest road conditions for the state you are
calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6 AM PST FRIDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET
